headline: AI buildouts could push Micron stock above $300: Analyst
summary: Micron Technology stock (MU) continues to soar in Thursday's session since reporting breakout fiscal first quarter earnings and revenue figures yesterday, driven by growing demand for high-bandwidth memory chips for AI data centers. Freedom Capital Markets Managing Director Paul Meeks shares how much higher the push for AI infrastructure buildouts could send Micron's stock price. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Wall St closes higher fueled by tech rally, soft inflation data
summary:
STORY: Wall Street's main indexes climbed on Thursday with the Dow edging up marginally, the S&P 500 adding eight tenths of one percent and the Nasdaq advancing about one point four percent.

A soft inflation report fueled expectations for more interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.

The Consumer Price Index report showed that consumer prices increased less than expected from a year earlier in November.

The moderation is likely due to technical reasons related to the government shutdown which prevented the collection of some data.

Meanwhile, a blowout forecast from chipmaker Micron Technology helped lift tech stocks on Thursday.

Micron shares jumped 10% after the company forecast quarterly profit at nearly double what analysts were expecting on strong AI demand.

It comes as massive debt-backed AI spending and unclear paths to profits have dampened risk-taking this quarter.

But Rob Sluymer, technical strategist with RBC Wealth Management, says he thinks AI-related stocks will continue to rise.

"So I think people are a little bit more nervous around some of the gains in these high momentum, expensive technology stocks. And I think that's why we've seen some volatility in some of the names, some of the data center stocks and software names that have pulled back very, very sharply. People are taking some of that risk down. Now, again, this is just the first pullback in an otherwise strong uptrend. I think it's pretty early to be making a case that these tech stocks are putting in a big top."

:: TAE Technologies

Other stocks on the move included Trump Media & Technology which surged roughly 42% after the company announced a merger with fusion power firm TAE Technologies in an all-stock deal valued at more than $6 billion.

headline: Micron Earnings ‘Best’ in Chip History After Nvidia. How Its Stock Became the New AI Darling.
summary: Micron  Technology earnings are out—and the AI trade may be back on track.  Micron Technology stock surged Thursday, the day after the memory chip maker reported better-than-expected earnings results and gave guidance that was significantly higher than expectations.  For the current quarter, Micron forecast a revenue range with a midpoint of $18.7 billion, above analysts’ expectations of $14.3 billion.

headline: Inflation cooled annually in November, Micron soars over memory chips
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman breaks down November's Consumer Price Index (CPI) report while covering the top market stories of December 18, 2025. A panel consisting of Interactive Brokers Chief Strategist Steve Sosnick, New Century Advisors Chief Economist Claudia Sahm, and Goldman Sachs Asset Management Head of Multi-Sector Fixed Income Investing Lindsay Rosner joins Julie in assessing the latest inflation data out this morning. Annex Wealth Management chief economist and strategist Brian Jacobsen also comes on the show to share his 2026 outlook for markets (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Inflation cooled annually in November, Micron soars over memory chips
content.description:
Morning Brief host Julie Hyman breaks down November's Consumer Price Index (CPI) report while covering the top market stories of December 18, 2025.

A panel consisting of Interactive Brokers Chief Strategist Steve Sosnick, New Century Advisors Chief Economist Claudia Sahm, and Goldman Sachs Asset Management Head of Multi-Sector Fixed Income Investing Lindsay Rosner joins Julie in assessing the latest inflation data out this morning.

Annex Wealth Management chief economist and strategist Brian Jacobsen also comes on the show to share his 2026 outlook for markets (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC).

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Markets Rebounding After AI Selloff as Fears Fade Ahead of Inflation Report
summary: Stocks looked set to rise on Thursday, following strong results from chip maker Micron that eased fears that the artificial intelligence spending boom is about to fizzle out.  Delayed inflation data due out on Thursday could quickly overshadow the results, though, with Wall Street still worried that a flare-up in price pressures could make it tougher for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates in early 2026.  Micron’s results offered “a timely antidote to worries that the AI spending boom is getting ahead of itself,” Hargreaves Lansdown analyst Matt Britzman said.

content.title: Markets Rebounding After AI Selloff as Fears Fade Ahead of Inflation Report
content.summary: Stocks looked set to rise on Thursday, following strong results from chip maker Micron that eased fears that the artificial intelligence spending boom is about to fizzle out.  Delayed inflation data due out on Thursday could quickly overshadow the results, though, with Wall Street still worried that a flare-up in price pressures could make it tougher for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates in early 2026.  Micron’s results offered “a timely antidote to worries that the AI spending boom is getting ahead of itself,” Hargreaves Lansdown analyst Matt Britzman said.

headline: Micron Crushes Earnings. The Stock Is Rising.
summary: Micron Technology  reported better-than-expected earnings results Wednesday afternoon.  For the November quarter, the chip company reported earnings per share of $4.78, compared to Wall Street’s consensus estimate of $3.96, according to FactSet.  Revenue came in at $13.6 billion, which was above analysts’ expectations of $12.9 billion.

headline: Micron surges as global memory chip shortage boosts profit forecast
summary: Micron Technology shares rose nearly 16% on Thursday, following an outsized profit forecast on the back of a worldwide ​supply crunch of memory chips amid robust demand from AI data centres. A memory ‌shortage across industries - from smartphones to sprawling data centres - has boosted prices, prompting Micron to forecast second-quarter adjusted profit ‌at nearly double of Wall Street expectations. This dynamic "is boosting incredible market pricing for Micron and its memory chip peers," Morningstar analysts wrote in a note.

content.title: Micron surges as global memory chip shortage boosts profit forecast
content.summary: Micron Technology shares rose nearly 16% on Thursday, following an outsized profit forecast on the back of a worldwide ​supply crunch of memory chips amid robust demand from AI data centres. A memory ‌shortage across industries - from smartphones to sprawling data centres - has boosted prices, prompting Micron to forecast second-quarter adjusted profit ‌at nearly double of Wall Street expectations. This dynamic "is boosting incredible market pricing for Micron and its memory chip peers," Morningstar analysts wrote in a note.

headline: MU Q4 Deep Dive: AI-Driven Demand Tightens Memory Supply, Spurs Strategic Capacity Expansion
summary: Memory chips maker Micron (NYSE:MU) reported Q4 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 56.7% year on year to $13.64 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($18.7 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 29.3% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.78 per share was 20.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: MU Q4 Deep Dive: AI-Driven Demand Tightens Memory Supply, Spurs Strategic Capacity Expansion
content.summary: Memory chips maker Micron (NYSE:MU) reported Q4 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 56.7% year on year to $13.64 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($18.7 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 29.3% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.78 per share was 20.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Wall Street rises after an encouraging inflation update, as Micron helps AI stocks stop their slide
summary: U.S. stocks rose on Thursday following an encouraging report on inflation  that could help the Federal Reserve keep cutting interest rates next year.  A strong profit report from Micron Technology also helped AI stocks halt their sharp slides, at least for now.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average added 65 points, or 0.1%, and the strength for tech stocks sent the Nasdaq composite up a market-leading 1.4%.

A strong profit report from Micron Technology also helped AI stocks halt their sharp slides, at least for now.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average added 65 points, or 0.1%, and the strength for tech stocks sent the Nasdaq composite up a market-leading 1.4%.

headline: Micron Technology (MU) Is Down 12.7% After Record AI-Driven Earnings and Bullish Revenue Guidance - What's Changed
